intro: Alchemilla brachycodon, commonly known as narrow-leaved lady's mantle, is a perennial plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in panicles during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Alchemilla brachycodon is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
